qas.question: Although Kanye was achieving fame by producing, what did he actually want to be?
What label declined to work with Kanye after many meetings?
What career was Kanye's ultimate dream?
What did Kanye West not have that made record companies turn him down?
Which record company turned Kanye down after many meetings?

context: Despite his success as a producer, West's true aspiration was to be a <a0_0><a2_0>rapper<a2_0/><a0_0/>. Though he had developed his rapping long before he began producing, it was often a challenge for West to be accepted as a rapper, and he struggled to attain a record deal. Multiple record companies ignored him because he did not portray the <a3_0>gangsta image<a3_0/> prominent in mainstream hip hop at the time. After a series of meetings with <a1_0><a4_0>Capitol Records<a4_0/><a1_0/>, West was ultimately denied an artist deal.
